channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Baron and Duke
channel.description:
This was concerning the a rework of the King I made in a feedback and suggestion thread.
https://forum.imperium42.com/t/the-kings-allies-they-gotta-go/34445
And this was also inspired by the fact at which I noticed that there is a Royal in every class type except for Support. Well, this is it!
The whole point of the Baron is to be there so that he can take over for the King in case he is needed. Same goes for the Duke, but the Duke is for the Unseen. (Also matches the Duchess at last)
[quote]
The Baron
Blue Dragon Support
_**Passives**_
**Royal Blood:** (Everyone should know what this is)
**Entitlement:** If you become the next King, you will keep your abilities alongside the abilities of succeeding Kings. (Not Starting King)
_**Abilities**_
**Royal Loan:** (4) (Day) Choose another player. Any limited night ability they use tonight will not lose a charge when used.
Not included for both Baron and Duke: Prince's Execute if Prince killed Blue Dragon Physician's Reanimate Assassin's 2 for 1
**Kinship:** (2) (Night) Choose any player and give them the Royal Blood passive if they do not have it. If that class already has two passives, they may not inherit Royal Blood.
Classes that Kinship will not work on (because they all have two passives): - Mastermind - Hunter - Mercenary - Fool - Inquisitor - Sorcerer - Possessor [/quote]
[quote]
The Duke
Unseen Support
_**Passives**_
**Royal Blood:** (Everyone should know what this is)
**Entitlement:** If you become the next King, you will keep your abilities when you become King alongside a succeeding King's abilities. Does not include Coup.
_**Abilities**_
**Kinship:** (1) (Night) Choose any player and give them the Royal Blood passive if they do not have it. If that class already has two passives, they may not inherit Royal Blood.
**Coup:** (1) (Night) Choose a player. Any non-killer class targeting the King tonight will be redirected to that player. Bypasses occupy immunity. (Not part of Entitlement passive when you become the King)
(Classes not redirected: Neutral Killers, Assassin, Knight) (Not redirected but can't target King anyways: Hunter, Prince, etc.)
**Royal Loan:** (4) (Day) Choose another player. Any limited night ability they use tonight will not lose a charge when used.
[/quote]
Changelog: - Added Entitlement Passive - Changed Entitlement Requirements - Removed Coup from Duke - Added Royal Loan ability to both Baron and Duke - Added Safeguard to Baron - Added Lockdown to Duke - Removed Safeguard and Lockdown - Changed Safeguard - Removed requirement for Entitlement - Added Kinship Ability to Baron - Added False Heir Ability to Duke - Re-added Coup to Duke - Edited Coup Ability

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Baron and Duke
item.dc:creator: Sheepish
item.description:
Okay, let’s check this again!

Livicus:

Entitlement:

If you become the next King, you will keep your limited abilities alongside the abilities of succeeding Kings. (Not Starting King)

It’s okay that Kinship replaces the unuseable Allies ability. However, Royal Loan should not be maintained, seeing that king already has two day abilities which are very important to be taken out.

Livicus:

Royal Loan: (4) (Day)

Choose another player. Any limited night ability they use tonight will not lose a charge when used.

Seems like a good ability to me . Especially considering the “Not included”.

Livicus:

Kinship: (2) (Night)

Choose another player. If they are a Blue Dragon who is not a Royal, you will grant them a hidden Royal Blood passive. If targeted player is either a Blue Dragon Royal, or a non-BD, they will not be granted Royal Blood. You will not see if Kinship worked for the targeted player.

So… as a king, why would you give someone Royal Blood? I mean, I can understand it being used as a last resort but…
Also, he can do two night actions in the game and then he is rendered useless at night? Doesn’t he have any unlimited uses ability or is that a work in progress?
I mean Kinship is a cool ability and could turn quite a few tables, nothing against it, just feel like he could use a second night ability with unlimited uses.

Livicus:

The Duke

I gotta say I love the names lol

Livicus:

Royal Loan: (3) (Day)

Choose another player. Any limited night ability they use tonight will not lose a charge when used.

Why does the unseen counterpart have fewer uses of Royal Loan? It should be the same.

Also, I’d make False Heir and Kinship the same ability. No need to make it weaker on the BD side. I’d maintain the name Kinship and the False Heir description.

Other than that, seems good to me!

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Baron and Duke
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Kinship and False Heir don’t show, I wanted to make these classes something less confirmable and say that a person is now Royal Blood.

And yes, I should add that Prince’s Execution and Physician’s Reanimate are not included in Royal Loan.

However I’ll say this, Butlers, Drunks, Hunter, and Prince can’t even target the King so they can’t be redirected with Coup. This is meant to thwart Physicians, Alchemists, Observers, who could be on the King.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Baron and Duke
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
Livicus:

Royal Loan: (4) (Day)

Choose another player. Any limited night ability they use tonight will not lose a charge when used.

This is fine but make Prince immune to it.

Livicus:

If you become the next King, you will keep your abilities when you become King alongside a succeeding King’s abilities.

This is also fine

Livicus:

Choose another player. If they are a Blue Dragon who is not a Royal, you will grant them a hidden Royal Blood passive. If targeted player is either a Blue Dragon Royal, or a non-BD, they will not be granted Royal Blood. You will not see if Kinship worked for the targeted player.

As long as the person does not see if it worked or the Baron does not see it this is good.

Livicus:

False Heir: (1) (Night)

Choose any player and give them Royal Blood. You may give Royal Blood to any player.

This makes it so that when people elect the Duke/Baron as King they will be suspicious of the Royal Blood False Heir.

Livicus:

Choose a player. Any non-killer class targeting the King tonight will be redirected to that player. Bypasses occupy immunity. (Not part of Entitlement passive when you become the King)

This confirms to Butlers and Drunks that there is a Duke. It should be slightly changed.
